subject: Re: There are 83 spam comments for every real comment [exclusive]
body:
On Jan. 27, at 01:20 PM, Eric Snapper wrote:
Hi Chris, 

I wanted to check in and see if you've had a chance to see our live updating WordPress stats page. I think it's incredible how far WordPress has come. Some cool things we learned doing this project is that new WordPress pages are brimming with content: Each new page has almost two instances of external content from Twitter, Flickr, YouTube, Vimeo, or Photobucket (1.8 embeds per new page), and that each new post brings about 10 new people to WordPress, and 15% of those people will leave comments about what they've read!

I'd love to hear your thoughts whenever you get a chance, and I'm happy to answer any questions you have or make any changes necessary if you're interested.

Best, 
Eric
 






-----Original Message-----
Hey Chris, 

I'm definitely going cable free. The only reason I have it now is because of sports, and the fact that it came with my internet! I already got myself an HD antenna and I have so many subscriptions that I have something to watch from here to eternity! 

I wanted to share a new project with you that brings me back to high school and middle school when I would use LiveJournal and Xanga with my friends, but then WordPress happened and it changed everything! We wanted to take a look at just how far WordPress blogging has come, so we created this live updating embeddable graphic showing WordPress stats and comparing them to other internet benchmarks.

We learned that there are as many WordPress pages as there are Wikipedia pages and that in just one day there are:
  • 600M WordPress page views.
  • 500M tweets.
  • 45M hours of Pandora music played.
  • 170K new WordPress pages.

I've always known you should never read the comments, but seriously 83 to 1 is insane! Do you think people might be interested seeing how WordPress has taken over blogging? I wanted to send this your way and see if you were interested in covering it. Let me know what you think when you get a chance!

Best,
Eric
